articles.title: Greetings to Malaysian King
articles.content:
Greetings to Malaysian King
						
 Pyongyang, August 31 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on Monday sent a message of greeting to Al-Sultan Almutasimu Billahi Muhibbudin Tuanku Alhaj Abdul Halim Muadzam Shah Ibni Al-Marhum Sultan Badlishah, king of Malaysia, on the occasion of its national day.
					 The message expressed belief that the good friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in line with the common interests and desire of the two peoples and sincerely wished friendly Malaysia steady development and prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Kyrgyzstan
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Kyrgyzstan
 Pyongyang, August 31 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, sent a message of greeting to Almazbek Atambaev, president of Kyrgyzstan, on Monday on the occasion of its national day.
					 The message expressed belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would favorably develop in conformity with the common interests and desire of the two peoples and wished the president great success in his work for the development of the country.

articles.title: Greetings to Malaysian PM
articles.content:
Greetings to Malaysian PM
						
 Pyongyang, August 31 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju sent a message of greeting to Datuk Seri Mohamad Najib Bin Tun Haji Abudul Razak, prime minister of Malaysia, on Monday on the occasion of its national day.
					 The message expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in various fields and wished him success in his responsible work for the development and prosperity of the country.
					
					 On the same day, DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong also sent a message of greeting to Malaysian Foreign Minister Datuk Anifah Aman.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Un from Bulgarian Taekwon-do Federation
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Un from Bulgarian Taekwon-do Federation 
						
 Pyongyang, August 31 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un was presented with a gift by the Bulgarian Taekwon-do Federation on August 26. 
					 The vice-mayor of Plovdiv City of Bulgaria conveyed the gift to Kim Kyong Ho, chairman of the Korean Taekwon-do Committee who is leading the DPRK Taekwon-do team which took part in the 19th World Taekwon-Do Championships.

articles.title: DPRK Delegation Leaves for Russia
articles.content:
DPRK Delegation Leaves for Russia
 Pyongyang, August 31 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the General Bureau of Civil Aviation of the DPRK headed by General Director Kang Ki Sop left here on Monday to visit Russia.

articles.title: Minister of External Economic Relations Leaves for Russia
articles.content:
Minister of External Economic Relations Leaves for Russia 
						
 Pyongyang, August 31 (KCNA) -- Ri Ryong Nam, minister of External Economic Relations, and his party left here Monday to take part in the Oriental Economic Forum to be held in Vladivostok of Russia.

articles.title: Japanese Delegation Visits International Friendship Exhibition House
articles.content:
Japanese Delegation Visits International Friendship Exhibition House
						
 Pyongyang, August 31 (KCNA) -- A delegation of Nippon Sport Science University led by Managing Director Kenshiro Matsunami Monday visited the International Friendship Exhibition House.
					 The guests paid tribute to the wax replicas of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk.
					
					 They went round gifts presented by party, state and government leaders and prominent figures of many countries.
					
					 After the visit the managing director said he came to know better how the world people revere the great leaders of Korea. He was moved to see many gifts presented by Japanese figures, he noted, wishing the relations between Japan and the DPRK would be normalized as soon as possible.
					
					 Meanwhile, leading members of the delegation toured the Jangchon Vegetable Co-op Farm in Sadong District, Pyongyang.

articles.title: National Exhibition of University Students' IT Achievements Closes
articles.content:
National Exhibition of University Students' IT Achievements Closes
						
 Pyongyang, August 31 (KCNA) -- A national exhibition of IT achievements made by university students was closed. It was opened on August 24 on the occasion of the Youth Day. 
					 Displayed there were achievements made by students across the country through their study and scientific pursuits.
					
					 400 inventions and software products were highly estimated.
					
					 Kim Il Sung University and Pyongyang City took special places.
					
					 A closing ceremony took place at the Three-Revolution Exhibition House on Monday.
					
					 Present there were officials concerned, officials of the youth league and students.
					
					 A closing address was made by Jon Yong Nam, chairman of the Central Committee of the youth league.

articles.title: 25th ITF General Meeting Held
articles.content:
25th ITF General Meeting Held
						
 Pyongyang, August 31 (KCNA) -- The 25th general meeting of the International Taekwon-Do Federation took place at Plovdiv City of Bulgaria on Aug. 26.
					 Present there were members of the ITF leading organ, more than 250 delegates and honorary guests of over 80 countries.
					
					 It was decided at the meeting to sponsor the 12th Juvenile and the 7th Veteran Taekwon-Do Championships in Italy in 2016 and hold the 20th World Taekwon-Do Championships in Pyongyang in 2017.
					
					 Ri Yong Son was elected president of the ITF and Jang Ung honorary president of the ITF there.

articles.title: Foreign Crewmen Meet in Run-up to DPRK's Birthday
articles.content:
Foreign Crewmen Meet in Run-up to DPRK's Birthday 
						
 Nampho, August 31 (KCNA) -- Foreign crewmen met at Nampho Port on Monday in the run-up to the 67th founding anniversary of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea. 
					 The participants laid a floral basket before the mosaic depicting President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il in Nampho City before paying tribute to them. 
					
					 Prior to the meeting, they went round the photos dealing with the revolutionary careers of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and the revolutionary exploits of Marshal Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 Present at the meeting were captains and crewmen of the Panama- flagged ships OUPULAI 18 and GLOBAL DREAM. 
					
					 Speakers at the meeting highly praised Kim Il Sung for founding the Workers' Party of Korea, the Korean People's Army and setting up on their basis a genuine government for the people, the first of its kind in history. 
					
					 They said Kim Il Sung was the outstanding leader who made a great contribution to the work for accomplishing the cause of global independence and protecting peace and security of the world. 
					
					 Kim Jong Il, regarding the military affair as the most important state affair for years and enabled the DPRK to emerge a nuclear weapons state, satellite producer and launcher despite the outrageous moves of the imperialists for aggression, the speakers noted. 
					
					 They expressed the belief that the Korean people would surely build a thriving socialist nation under the leadership of Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 A letter to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the meeting.

articles.title: Psammotherapy in Kaesong of DPRK
articles.content:
Psammotherapy in Kaesong of DPRK
 Pyongyang, August 31 (KCNA) -- In Kaesong City of the DPRK there is Mami Streamlet famous for psammotherapy, which is four kilometers southeast of the central city.
					 The psammotherapy there has been believed to be as effective as insam.
					
					 According to Ryom Jong Chol, section chief of the Kaesong City People's Committee, sand in Mami Streamlet contains Mg, Fe, Cu, Si, Mn, Ca, carbonate and other ingredients good for human body.
					
					 The treatment by sand bath is efficacious for rheumatic arthritis, neuralgia, bruise, postoperative complication, cholelithiasis, dermatosis and various chronic diseases.
					
					 Kim Yong Hui, an inhabitant in Poson-dong, Kaesong City, said that she was getting better of brachialgia after three days of psammotherapy.

articles.title: Spa Villages in DPRK
articles.content:
Spa Villages in DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, August 31 (KCNA) -- Balneotherapy is getting popularity among people in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 According to data available from the Ministry of Public Health, tens of thousands of citizens have taken balneotherapy as of August this year.
					
					 New spa villages took their shapes across the country in the last 10-odd years. Among them are those in Samchon County of South Hwanghae Province, Tongsin County of Jagang Province, Unsan County of North Phyongan Province, Phangyo County of Kangwon Province and Myongchon County of North Hamgyong Province.
					
					 As a result, the housing capacity for bathers has doubled the last century's.
					
					 Thanks to the universal free medical care system, people are taking free medical care at health resorts and sanatoria in the DPRK.

articles.title: Drama "Wolf" Re-created in DPRK
articles.content:
Drama "Wolf" Re-created in DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, August 31 (KCNA) -- The performance of drama "Wolf" is now going on at the National Theater in Pyongyang.
					 The drama, adapted from a short novel "Wolf" written by Han Sol Ya in Juche 40 (1951), has been recently re-created by the National Theatrical Troupe.
					
					 It lays bare the brutality of the U.S. imperialists as it is based on atrocities committed by Americans who paved the way for invasion in the guise of missionary and doctor during Japan's colonial rule over Korea.
					
					 The drama tells the truth that the illusion about the U.S. leads only to death.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Dashing ahead towards October Festival
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Dashing ahead towards October Festival 
						
 Pyongyang, August 31 (KCNA) -- The single-minded unity is the most precious revolutionary legacy handed down by leader Kim Jong Il and the source of all victories of the great Paektusan nation, says Rodong Sinmun Monday in an editorial.
					 It calls upon all party members, service personnel and people to give full play to the unbreakable unity and cohesion and the might of the single-minded unity which the imperialists fear most and to dash ahead towards October festival.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The army and people have made patriotic devotions, creations and innovations in the defence of the country and all sites for building a thriving nation with the spirit and pluck of Mt. Paektu from the outset of this year, single-mindedly united around the great party. 
					
					  The DPRK's capability for self-defence has been significantly bolstered up and a great advance made in building of an economic power and a highly civilized nation under the banner of Songun.
					
					  A high-pitched drive is under way to create the Korean speed in building monumental edifices in the era of Songun and the DPRK's sports persons are fully demonstrating its honor and dignity in international games. The single-minded unity demonstrated before the world even under the situation which reached the brink of a war represents the inexhaustible power and invincible spirit of Songun Korea. 
					
					 We should make uninterrupted advances and innovations by giving full play to the surging revolutionary spirit and matchless strength.
					
					 All party members, service personnel and people should increase the speed of all-out charge to the maximum full of conviction of sure victory and thus proudly greet the grand festival of October.
					
					 The editorial calls on all service personnel and people to dynamically wage all-out charge toward the festival celebrating the 70th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea, rallied close around Marshal Kim Jong Un, and thus glorify this year as a great revolutionary jubilee for prospering Songun Korea.

articles.title: Songun Is Eternal Banner for Victory of Korean Revolution: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Songun Is Eternal Banner for Victory of Korean Revolution: Rodong Sinmun
						
 Pyongyang, August 31 (KCNA) -- Songun represents a glorious tradition of the Korean revolution, symbol of the dignity and might of the DPRK and a treasured sword for bringing happiness to the people, Rodong Sinmun Monday says in an article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 Songun was the revolutionary idea and practices of leader Kim Jong Il and his political idea and mode.
					
					 He performed great exploits by steering the revolution and construction to victory by dint of the might of Songun for over half a century since the day he started the Songun revolutionary leadership.
					
					 He honorably defended socialism of Juche under the uplifted banner of Songun in the trying period when the destiny of the country and nation were at the crossroads of life and death and ensured steady succession to the Korean revolution. This was a miracle of history which could be worked only by him. 
					
					 Thanks to Songun, the DPRK's dignity and might could be put on the highest level in the 5 000-year-long history of the nation and it could make a giant stride forward to surpass the world standard.
					
					 The June 15 era of reunification was ushered in, a fresh turning phase of national reunification brought about and victories were won in the nuclear stand-off with the U.S. one after anther to startle the world. All this would have been unthinkable without Kim Jong Il's original Songun politics. 
					
					 Supreme leader Kim Jong Un is now dynamically advancing the revolution and construction the way Kim Jong Il did, regarding his Songun revolutionary idea and exploits as the eternal treasures of Kim Il Sung's nation and Kim Jong Il's Korea.
					
					 The unshakable faith and will of Kim Jong Un, the great brilliant commander of Mt. Paektu, to win the final victory of the revolutionary cause of Juche by dint of the might of Songun serve as a basic source of the high dignity and victory of the great Paektusan nation.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Hails Publication of Joint Press Release at North-South High-Level Urgent Contact
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Hails Publication of Joint Press Release at North-South High-Level Urgent Contact 
						
 Pyongyang, August 31 (KCNA) -- A joint press release issued at the north-south high-level urgent contact marked an landmark occasion of defusing the acute military tension and putting the catastrophic inter-Korean relations on the track of reconciliation and trust, says Rodong Sinmun Monday in an article. 
					 It goes on:
					
					 The publication of the joint press release is a historic agreement that saved the destiny of the nation from a crisis.
					
					 The urgent contact should not be confined to settling the prevailing dangerous situation on the Korean Peninsula. The north and the south had a wide-ranging discussion on the issues of putting the prevailing grave situation under control and improving the inter-Korean relations and issued a joint press release on its basis. This reflected the will and stand of both sides to prevent armed conflicts between the north and the south, defuse tension and promote the development of the inter-Korean relations.
					
					 The north and the south sat face to face in a serious crisis, sympathized with the gravity of the situation and had an exhaustive discussion, reaching an agreement on common tasks. This resulted in opening a landmark phase in improving the inter-Korean relations. This was the significance of the contact.
					
					 The whole course of the urgent contact and its outcome proved once again that there is noting impossible when they settle all issues arising in the inter-Korean relations in the spirit of By Our Nation Itself.
					
					 The north and south authorities have heavy responsibilities to make a new history of the inter-Korean relations. The north and the south should regard the agreement as a sacred commitment to the nation and positively opt for implementing it.
					
					 Whether the agreement reached at the urgent contact remains a dead paper or yields rich results depends on what stand and attitude both sides take towards the joint press release and how they implement it.
					
					 All the Koreans and history are following them.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Urged to Stop Staging War Drills for Aggression against Dialogue Partner together with Outsiders
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Urged to Stop Staging War Drills for Aggression against Dialogue Partner together with Outsiders 
 Pyongyang, August 31 (KCNA) -- Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military exercises came to an end on August 28 after it started on August 17.
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday observes in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 The U.S. and the south Korean authorities, when kicking off Ulji Freedom Guardian, described the drills as "annual" and "defensive" but with no rhetoric could they cover up their aggressive nature. 
					
					 The joint military drills only hurt the fundamental interests of the nation and incite mistrust and confrontation between the north and the south.
					
					 Military threat will never help resolve any issue. Confrontation and conflict are harmful to both the north and the south and will only create an uncontrollable situation. The north and the south should keep afloat the hard-won trend of detente and develop it. What arouses serious concern of the public at home and abroad against this background is that the south Korean authorities staged together with the U.S. the largest-ever 2015integrated firepower annihilation drill  targeting the DPRK on August 28, a few days after the north-south high-level urgent contact.
					
					 The drill is nothing helpful to stabilizing the situation.
					
					 It goes without saying that such military provocations rattling the nerves of the dialogue partner and ratcheting up the tension will only chill the atmosphere of improving the north-south relations and do harm to the stable management of the situation.
					
					 We will never tolerate any provocation detrimental to peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should halt the aggressive war drills with outsiders targeting the dialogue partner and positively respond to the joint efforts for defusing the danger of war and achieving peace and reunification on the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: Probe into Truth about Sewol Disaster and Salvage of Wreck Urged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Probe into Truth about Sewol Disaster and Salvage of Wreck Urged in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, August 31 (KCNA) -- The April 16 Consultative Council of Families in south Korea held a meeting for honoring the memory of victims of the ferry Sewol disaster in Ansan, Kyonggi Province on August 28, according to south Korean KBS.
					 The participants said it is 500 days since the occurrence of the Sewol disaster. But the truth about the incident that claimed hundreds of lives has not yet been probed, they deplored.
					
					 They urged the "government" to salvage Sewol as soon as possible to have the grudge of the bereaved families settled.

articles.title: Unpopular Labor Policy in S. Korea Rejected
articles.content:
Unpopular Labor Policy in S. Korea Rejected
						
 Pyongyang, August 31 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions held a rally in Seoul on August 28 in protest against the unpopular labor policy, according to KBS of south Korea.
					 The labor market reform touted by the "government" will entail easy lay-off of workers and expansion of part-time jobs, the body disclosed.
					
					This will make youth and workers suffer from worse unemployment, it deplored.
					
					 Refuting the unpopular labor policy, the organization declared it would reject negotiations and continue fighting.

articles.title: Decision of Supreme Court Opposed in S. Korea
articles.content:
Decision of Supreme Court Opposed in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, August 31 (KCNA) -- The Bar Association for Democratic Society filed a lawsuit against the decision of the Supreme Court that defended an "emergency measure", according to the Voice of People, south Korean internet newspaper.
					 In 2013 the "constitutional court" ruled illegal the "emergency measures" dating back to the period of "yusin regime," charging that they lack justifications for legislation and also seriously restricted or violated the fundamental rights of the people including the freedom of expression, assembly and demonstration and the academic freedom. 
					
					 However, the "constitutional court" shunned the decision, citing a clause that prohibits lawsuit for trial.
					
					 The Supreme Court's decision deserves punishment as it violated the basic rights of the people by applying legislation that had already been rendered invalid by the decision of the "constitutional court," the organization said.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Congratulatory Message Carried by Nepalese Newspaper
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Congratulatory Message Carried by Nepalese Newspaper
						
 Pyongyang, August 31 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un's congratulatory message which was sent to the  women football players who won the title of the 2015 EAFF East Asian Cup was carried by the Nepalese newspaper Arpan on August 21.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Highly Praised by Nepalese Organizations
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Highly Praised by Nepalese Organizations
						
 Pyongyang, August 31 (KCNA) -- The Nepal Communist Party (Marxist-Leninist) and the Nepalese Association for Supporting the Songun Politics released a joint statement on August 22 on the occasion of the Day of Songun.
					 The statement said that August 25 this year is the 55th anniversary of the day when H.E. Kim Jong Il started the Songun revolutionary leadership with his guidance to the Seoul Ryu Kyong Su Guards 105th Tank Division of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 Global progressives including the Nepalese people joined the DPRK in celebrating the significant Day of Songun, the statement noted, adding:
					
					 We deeply felt once again that he was an outstanding Songun brilliant commander boundlessly revered by all people as he demonstrated the dignity and might of the DPRK by dint of Songun.
					
					 We are well aware of the Songun politics and we extend full support and solidarity to the Korean people in their struggle to defend peace and security on the Korean Peninsula by respecting the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration and achieving the independent and peaceful reunification of the country in the idea of By Our Nation Itself.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Exploits Praised by Foreign Papers
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Exploits Praised by Foreign Papers
						
 Pyongyang, August 31 (KCNA) -- Foreign papers featured articles illustrated with photos of leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un from August 21 to 25.
					 The Russian paper Bremya Peremon Plus TV said a new era of building a thriving socialist nation opened up in the DPRK thanks to HE Kim Jong Il who held aloft the banner of Songun.
					
					 The eye-opening reality in the DPRK always emerging victorious by dint of the single-minded unity would be unthinkable without his Songun leadership exploits, it added.
					
					 Iran News praised him as a peerlessly brilliant commander of Songun, saying the DPRK has firmly defended its sovereignty and dignity in the confrontation with the U.S. for over half a century since he started his Songun revolutionary leadership.
					
					 The Syrian paper Al Baath noted the undying exploits of HE Kim Jong Il who laid an eternal foundation for everlasting prosperity of the country and the nation with his outstanding and experienced Songun leadership will shine forever along with the Day of Songun in the DPRK.
					
					 The Kuwaiti paper Al Shahid said the Korean people are celebrating the Day of Songun every year, adding Songun means going along the road of socialism without any slightest deviation and it is the symbol of independence and dignity.
					
					 The Bangladeshi paper Daily Folk carried an article dealing with the Songun leadership exploits of Kim Jong Il and successes being made by the service personnel and people of the DPRK in their efforts for building a thriving nation and reunifying the country under the leadership of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Congratulatory Visits Paid to DPRK Embassy in Abuja
articles.content:
Congratulatory Visits Paid to DPRK Embassy in Abuja
						
 Pyongyang, August 31 (KCNA) -- Alhassan Mamman Muhammad, chairman of the Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, and Igwanagu Nicholas, chairman of the Nigerian Group for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, paid congratulatory visits to the DPRK embassy in Abuja August 25, the 55th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of the Songun revolutionary leadership.
					 They laid bouquets before the full-length painting portraying President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and paid highest tribute to them.
					
					 Alhassan Mamman Muhammad said that Kim Jong Il brought up the Korean People's Army to be matchless army with his Songun revolutionary leadership.
					
					 He noted that Kim Jong Il attached great significance to the work for strengthening the People's Army politically and ideologically and in military technique and worked hard for their realization.
					
					 He stressed that the DPRK has always won victory in the confrontation with provokers and would demonstrate only victories in the future, too, under the leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un who is possessed of talented military stratagem.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita Dia Nacional de Malasia
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita Dia Nacional de Malasia
Pyongyang, 31 de agosto (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 31 un mensaje de felicitacion al rey de Malasia, Al-Sultan Almutasimu Billahi Muhibbudin Tuanku Alhaj Abdul Halim Muadzam Shah Ibni Al-Marhum Sultan Badlishah, con motivo del Dia Nacional. 
					Convencido de que las excelentes relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre la RPDC y Malasia se fortaleceran y se desarrollaran mas tambien en el futuro conforme a la aspiracion e intereses comunes de los pueblos de ambos paises, el remitente desea de todo corazon al destinatario el incesante desarrollo y prosperidad de Malasia, pais amistoso.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam envia mensaje de felicitacion al presidente de Kirguizistan
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam envia mensaje de felicitacion al presidente de Kirguizistan 
						
Pyongyang, 31 de agosto (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio este lunes un mensaje al presidente de la Republica de Kirguizistan, Almazbek Atambaev, para felicitarle por el Dia Nacional de su pais. 
					El remitente expresa la conviccion de que las relaciones de amistad entre los dos paises se desarrollaran favorablemente conforme a la aspiracion e intereses de los pueblos de ambos paises y le desea al destinatario grandes exitos en su trabajo para el desarrollo del pais.

articles.title: Clausurada Exposicion Nacional de Exitos Cientifico-Tecnicos de Informatica de Estudiantes
articles.content:
Clausurada Exposicion Nacional de Exitos Cientifico-Tecnicos de Informatica de Estudiantes
Pyongyang, 31 de agosto (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar este lunes en la Exposicion Permanente de las Tres Revoluciones la ceremonia de clausura de la Exposicion Nacional de Exitos Cientifico-Tecnicos de Informatica de Estudiantes con la participacion de los funcionarios correspondientes y de la Union de la Juventud Socialista Kim Il Sung y los jovenes universitarios. 
					En el presente certamen, iniciado el dia 24 con motivo del Dia de la Juventud, se presentaron muchos exitos alcanzados por los estudiantes de todo el pais en sus estudios y sus actividades de investigacion cientifica. 
					
					Fueron apreciados 400 invenciones y productos de software. 
					
					La Universidad Kim Il Sung y la Ciudad de Pyongyang ganaron el grado especial. 
					
					El presidente del Comite Central de la UJS, Jon Yong Nam, pronuncio la palabra de clausura.

articles.title: Tratamiento medico con arena Samdaem de Kaesong
articles.content:
Tratamiento medico con arena Samdaem de Kaesong
						
Pyongyang, 31 de agosto (ACNC) -- A orillas del riachuelo Mami a los 4 km de distancia al sureste del centro de la ciudad de Kaesong de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea se encuentra un lugar reconocido ampliamente desde la antiguedad por el tratamiento medico con arena caliente Samdaem. 
					Tradicionalmente, los moradores vienen curando con esta arena sus enfermedades. 
					
					Citado por la ACNC, el jefe de departamento del Comite Popular de la Ciudad de Kaesong, Ryom Jong Chol, dijo que la arena del riachuelo Mami contienen Mg, Fe, Cu, Si, Mn, Ca y otros elementos utiles para el cuerpo humano. 
					
					El agua, que corre por entre los arenales, contiene carbonato, magnesio, etc.
					
					El calor de la arena, los rayos ultravioletas, el aire fresco y el agua fria activan el metabolismo, la circulacion de sangre y el sistema nervioso. 
					
					Para curar las enfermedades hay que cubrir con la arena calentada de 40oC-45oC todo el cuerpo o la parte que debe ser curada. Y despues de 10 minutos banan el cuerpo con el agua que corre. Se necesita repetirlo tres dias con 3 veces al dia. 
					
					Este metodo de curacion surte efecto en el tratamiento de artritis reumatica, neuralgia, contusion, secuelas de operacion quirurgica, litiasis biliar, dermatosis y otras enfermedades cronicas. 
					
					La moradora del barrio de Poson de la ciudad de Kaesong, Kim Yong Hui dijo que este metodo le dio gran efecto en el tratamiento de neuralgia humeral en comparacion con acupuntura y medicina moderna.
